messages: edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (20:12): hmm, maybe http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/public-html/2008Apr/0051.html was a joke
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (20:17): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554, could you elaborate on why <ext> is better?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (20:18): (on the list, preferably)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:18): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: it's mainly down to what I think will affect legacy content the least
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (20:20): having to use <ext> to use something as basic as graphics or math on the Web seems like a pain
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (20:20): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: I am a little suspicious that you agree with me :)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:20): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: I agree with you? Oh no. I need to change my opinion now :)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:21): (On a more serious note, it proves that I don't, as has been accused, blindingly follow what Hixie says)
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (20:21): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: it's one element... it's essentially like a div, and that's as common as mosquitoes in Louisiana
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (20:22): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: did Hixie tell you to say that? ;P
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:22): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: So I can take that as mosquitoes in Louisiana are as common as div elements, seeming I don't know how common they are?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:22): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: Yes ;'(
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (20:22): Both math and graphics already have a container. I don't really see the need to have two. Also, I don't like <div>
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (20:22): yes, by the transitive property of elements and insects
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (20:23): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: but they don't have a fallback mechanism
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:23): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: But what about things apart from maths and graphics?
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (20:23): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: louisiana is famously hot and swampy
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (20:23): (and, after Katrina, under water)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:23): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: Not famous enough for me to know :)
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (20:24): ants at a picnic, then?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (20:24): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6, I don't think we need fallback works that well
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (20:25): oops
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (20:25): I don't think fallback works that well
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (20:25): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: I loaf cow pickle seems
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (20:25): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: how does it not work well?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (20:26): Authors will simply use whatever the dominant UA supports with perhaps some SEO spam/accessibility aid in alt="".
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (20:26): So if the dominant UA supports SVG there's no incentive to put fallback stuff for down-level UAs. This becomes even more true when all UAs support SVG.

227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (20:26): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: anyone who agrees with Hixie in public more than they disagree with him will be accused of being part of a conspiracy, so don't let that get to you
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:27): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: I don't :P
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (20:27): (Having fallback might also give less incentive for UAs to support something.)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:27): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: I just muck around with the fact I'm accused :)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:27): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: (though maybe not the best thing to do in the atmosphere :()
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (20:27): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: then quit yer bellyaching
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:27): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: What do you expect of someone my age!?
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (20:28): sitting around all night playing GTA?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:28): But I'm not 18! I can't play GTA!
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (20:28): you have to be 18 to play GTA?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:28): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: under British law, yeah
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (20:29): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554, you liar. You said you were 43!
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (20:29): I thought you guys beat the nazis in WWII
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:29): a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9: Remember the disclaimer of everything I say on April 1st being bullshit :)
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (20:29): But I thought that disclaimer was bullshit ;)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:29): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: (admittedly, I'm getting GTA4 for my 16th birthday this month)

227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (20:30): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: those don't seem like reasons *not* to have a fallback, since we can't rely on a UA supporting SVG and MathML (especially retroactively)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:31): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: Though legally it is a min. age to buy it, not to own it
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (20:31): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: so, basically, I was right?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:31): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: I've been playing Crackdown recently, but close enough :)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:31): http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BBFC FWIW
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (20:32): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6, you will have transition issues nonetheless, given <foreignObject> and <semantics> and all
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (20:32): I got my parents to buy GTA1 for me and fortunately they didn't notice it said '18' on it
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (20:32): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: yup, some transition issues seem inevitable, but we can minimize their impact
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:33): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: heh. My parents know damned well what it's like‚Ä¶ At least partially.
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (20:34): Now you can just borrow a credit card and buy it on Steam and there won't even be a box to raise suspicions
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:34): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: consoles ftw
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (20:35): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6, I don't think there's much impact to begin with
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:35): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: Oh, and I'll probably give you a hard challenge with an XHTML site I'll be working on late this year.
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (20:35): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: I think there are definitely impact issues on the larger Web environment
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (20:37): really wants to play Portal... I played several levels, and it was fun
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:37): brb (then I go work on http-parsing)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (20:37): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: I would recommend wanting to play Portal :-)
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (20:38): I played it at a friend's house... I need to find time to get over there again to finish it
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (20:42): It's only a few hours long, so it should be easier to find time than for most other games
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:47): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: I guess you could also take GTA as going against what a minority of emos do: self-harm; just digitally doing it :P
